result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Adam Thomas

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 10:02 a.m.  Court calls this case and Case # 22CF33 from Ashland, WI via Zoom. Attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Tyler William Wickman in court for Carl Adam Thomas.  Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty Jr. in court for Carl Adam Thomas.  Defendant Carl Adam Thomas in court. Here today for preliminary hearings on both cases.  10:25 a.m.  D.A. begins direct questioning of Officer Max Samardich on this case.  Officer was previously sworn in by clerk on 22CF33 and remains under oath.   DA hands copies of bond paperwork to witness Samardich and asks questions re: same.  Aty. Wick asks to look at documents quickly.  Cross by atty. Wickman.  No re-direct, but DA asks Court to take judicial notice of bond information.  Atty. Wickman has no objection re: judicial notice.  Court takes judicial notice of information in Case #22CF33.   No further re-direct.  D.A. has no other witnesses or evidence.  Final argument made by DA .  Bindover requested by DA.  Final argument by atty. Wickman.  Court sees evidence a traffic stop occurred along with the court record.  Case bound over and scheduled for arraignment on 11/07/22 at 8:30 a.m.  Everyone may appear by Zoom if they like.  Court adjourned at 10:37 a.m.  wmg
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:39 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Judge McKnight appears with CR via Zoom from Ashland County.  Def appears with Attys. Rafferty and Wickland from Atty Rafferty's office via Zoom.  WTLPH on file.  Prelims to be set in both cases for 10/13 at 10:00 a.m. for 30 minutes.  Def will most likely be in person.  If an emergency or def unable to appear in person, def can appear via Zoom as long as video appearance.  Adj.  8:41 a.m.  klr
Status conference on September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 10:25 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances and charges.  Def appears via Zoom with Atty Wickman and Atty Rafferty from Atty Rafferty's office.  Per Atty Rafferty, def waives reading of complaint and WTLPH.  Case to be set for PTC on 6/30 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  10:27 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 000554,
Payable Number: 35902,
Receipt Number: 22R 000945,
Amount: $20.00

05-20-22 PC/Bond hearing minutes:  11:51 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Atty Joseph Rafferty makes special appearance for def.  PC Statement provided to Court.  Atty Rafferty addresses Court.  No alcohol involved.  Offcr. Max Samardich signed statement per Court.  Court reads statement.  Court finds PC.  Parties stip to $500 cash bond - no new terms.  Une 6th for init on this matter with other case.  10:00 Comp. to be filed within a weeek.  Atty Rafferty addresses Court.  Asks case be allowed to file before initial date of 6/3.  Court questions def.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  Def not to drive any veh anywhere.  Adj.  11:57 a.m.  klr
